Security & Privacy.description: Implements features to protect sessions and user data, including end-to-end encryption, two-factor authentication (2FA), and a privacy mode that can blank the remote screen during a session.

files.description: This file is the Polish translation of the Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct, outlining behavioral standards, enforcement procedures, and consequences for participants in the community.
This file contains the Norwegian version of the Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct for the RustDesk project, outlining expected behaviors and enforcement procedures for community members.

This file is the German version of the Code of Conduct for contributors, outlining expected behaviors, unacceptable actions, and enforcement procedures within the RustDesk community. It details commitments to an inclusive environment and consequences for violations.

This document outlines the Code of Conduct for contributors and community members, defining acceptable and unacceptable behaviors, and detailing the enforcement guidelines and consequences for violations within the RustDesk community in Dutch.
This file outlines the security policy for the RustDesk project, detailing how users can responsibly report security vulnerabilities via email.

This file contains the Contributor Code of Conduct for the RustDesk project, written in Romanian. It outlines expected behaviors, unacceptable actions, enforcement responsibilities, and consequences for contributors to foster a welcoming and inclusive community.
This document outlines the security policy for RustDesk in German, detailing how users can responsibly report security vulnerabilities via email.
This file outlines the security policy for the RustDesk project, detailing how users should responsibly report discovered vulnerabilities via email.

This file contains the Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct, outlining behavioral expectations, unacceptable conduct, and enforcement procedures for participants in the RustDesk community to foster an inclusive environment.
This file is the Chinese version of the Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct. It outlines expected behavior, commitments, standards, and enforcement policies for community members and contributors.
This document outlines the security policy for the RustDesk project, providing instructions on how to responsibly report security vulnerabilities via email.

This file provides the Russian version of the project's Code of Conduct, detailing expected behavior, unacceptable actions, and enforcement procedures for participants and contributors. It aims to foster a respectful and inclusive community environment.
This file contains the Korean version of the Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct, outlining expected behaviors and enforcement policies for community participation.
This document outlines the security policy for the RustDesk project in Romanian, providing instructions for users to responsibly report security vulnerabilities via email.

This document provides security guidelines for the RustDesk project, instructing users on how to responsibly report discovered vulnerabilities via email, while also noting the absence of a bug bounty program.

This document outlines the security policy for the RustDesk project, requesting users to report vulnerabilities responsibly via email to info@rustdesk.com, and noting the absence of a bug bounty program.

This document outlines RustDesk's security policy, detailing how users should report security vulnerabilities. It provides an email address for responsible disclosure and notes the absence of a bug bounty program.

This document outlines the security policy for the RustDesk project, providing instructions for responsibly reporting security vulnerabilities via email. It also states the current absence of a bug bounty program.

This document outlines the security policy for the RustDesk project, detailing how users can responsibly report security vulnerabilities. It encourages reporting issues via email to info@rustdesk.com, noting that there is currently no bug bounty program.
This script provides a command-line interface for interacting with a task management API, primarily for creating, managing, and monitoring file signing tasks for executables and other file types.

This `pam.d` directory is likely intended to store Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM) configuration files for RustDesk on Unix-like systems. Although currently empty, its presence suggests a potential role in handling authentication services. It might serve as a placeholder for custom or future PAM integration.

This file implements two-factor authentication (2FA) using TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password), including generation, verification, and persistence. It also integrates with Telegram bots for sending 2FA codes and managing bot credentials.

This file defines a privacy mode system with platform-specific implementations for Windows and macOS. It provides a trait for privacy mode functionality and manages switching between different implementations, allowing clients to turn privacy mode on or off for specific connections.

This file implements the `PrivacyMode` trait specifically for macOS, using an external C function to enable or disable the system's privacy mode. It manages the state of privacy mode for a given connection ID on macOS.
This file implements a screen capturer for Windows using the Magnifier API, specifically designed for privacy mode to exclude designated privacy windows from the capture.

This file implements Windows low-level keyboard and mouse hooks to enforce a "privacy mode" by intercepting and potentially blocking user input. It allows disabling the privacy mode via a 'Ctrl+P' key combination.

This file implements Windows-specific privacy mode functionality for RustDesk by creating a dedicated process, injecting a DLL into it, and managing a privacy window to enforce privacy during remote sessions.

This file implements a privacy mode feature for Windows by managing and manipulating virtual displays using the Windows API. It creates, configures, and sets virtual displays as primary to obscure the physical display content.
This file implements a Windows-specific privacy mode that prevents screen capture, checking for Windows 10 version 2004 or later for compatibility.

This file defines common utilities, constants, and global states used throughout the RustDesk application. It includes definitions for input handling, platform-specific configurations, feature compatibility checks, and application role management.

This document outlines the guidelines and procedures for contributing to the RustDesk project, including rules for pull requests, commit messages, and communication. It serves as a guide for anyone wishing to submit code or changes to the repository.

This document outlines the guidelines and procedures for contributing to the RustDesk project, including pull request requirements, commit policies, and communication channels. It serves as a guide for anyone looking to help develop RustDesk.

This document outlines the guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project, including pull request procedures, coding standards, and communication channels. It serves as a guide for developers wishing to submit changes or new features.

This document provides guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project, covering the pull request process, commit standards, and community conduct. It serves as a guide for developers looking to contribute code or other improvements.
This file is the Ukrainian language README for the RustDesk project, providing an overview of the remote desktop application, build instructions, file structure, and screenshots.

This file provides guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project, detailing the process for pull requests, commit requirements, and communication channels. It is the Polish version of the contributing document.
This is the Chinese README file for the RustDesk remote desktop software, providing an overview of its features, build instructions (including Docker), architecture, and usage details.
This document outlines the guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project, including instructions for pull requests, commit best practices, and communication channels.
This document provides guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project. It outlines the process for submitting pull requests, commit requirements, and communication channels for contributors.

This file is the Greek translation of the RustDesk project's README, providing an overview of the remote desktop software, build instructions, and project structure.

This file provides guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project, detailing the process for pull requests, commit requirements, and communication channels.
This file is the Czech localization of the RustDesk project's README, providing an overview, build instructions, and file structure for the remote desktop software.

This document outlines the guidelines and procedures for contributing to the RustDesk project, including instructions for pull requests, commit requirements, and communication channels. It is the German version of the contribution guide.

This is the Danish README file for the RustDesk project. It provides an overview of RustDesk, build instructions for various platforms and Docker, an explanation of the file structure, and screenshots.

This file is the Finnish localization of the RustDesk README, providing an overview of the remote desktop software, instructions for building it, its dependencies, and a breakdown of its file structure.

This file provides guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project, including pull request procedures, commit standards, and communication channels. It is the Japanese version of the contributing document.

This is the Norwegian (NO) README file for RustDesk, providing an overview of the remote desktop software, instructions on how to build it from source or with Docker, its file structure, and links to related resources.
This file is the French-language README for the RustDesk project, providing an overview of the remote desktop software, instructions for building it from source, and details on its project structure.

This file provides guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project, detailing the process for submitting Pull Requests, important considerations for commits, and communication channels. It serves as a comprehensive guide for developers looking to contribute to the project.

This file provides guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project, covering procedures for pull requests, commit requirements, and communication channels for contributors. It is written in Romanian.

This file is the Spanish-language README for the RustDesk remote desktop software. It provides an overview of RustDesk, instructions for compilation (including dependencies and Docker), details on the file structure, and screenshots of the application.
This file provides guidelines for contributing to the RustDesk project. It outlines the process for submitting contributions, pull request checklists, and communication channels for contributors.
This file is the Korean-language README for the RustDesk remote desktop software, providing an overview, build instructions (including dependencies and Docker), file structure, and screenshots.
This is the Malayalam localization of the RustDesk project's README file, providing an overview of the remote desktop software, build instructions, dependencies, and file structure in Malayalam.

This directory is designated to contain automated tests for the `flutter` application component within the RustDesk project. Although currently empty, its purpose is to host unit, widget, or integration tests to ensure code quality and functionality.

This directory is a standard component of an Xcode workspace (`Runner.xcworkspace`) within a Flutter project's iOS integration. It is designed to store shared project-level data, such as build schemes or breakpoint configurations, that are accessible to all developers working on the project. Its current emptiness indicates that no such shared data has been explicitly defined or committed for this workspace.

This directory stores shared Xcode schemes for the `Runner.xcodeproj` within the Flutter iOS project. These schemes define how the iOS application is built, run, tested, and archived by Xcode, ensuring consistent configurations across development environments.

This directory is a standard location within an Xcode workspace (`.xcworkspace`) used to store shared development data, primarily build schemes. Its purpose is to ensure consistent build, run, and test configurations across all developers working on the iOS portion of the Flutter project. Being empty indicates no shared schemes or specific configurations are currently committed for this workspace.

This directory contains shared configuration data for the Xcode workspace, specifically for the Flutter macOS application 'rustdesk'. It typically stores settings like schemes and build configurations that are shared among developers working on the project.

This directory is intended to store configuration files specifically for the macOS runner of the RustDesk Flutter application. It serves as a placeholder for various build configurations or environment-specific settings for the macOS desktop client, even if currently empty.

This directory stores shared Xcode build schemes for the `Runner.xcodeproj` project, which defines how the macOS Flutter application is built, tested, and run. These schemes ensure consistent development and build configurations across different developer environments for the RustDesk project.

This directory is part of an Xcode workspace within a Flutter project for macOS. It is intended to store shared project data, such as build scheme configurations or breakpoint settings, that are common among developers. As it is currently empty, it serves as a placeholder for these shared developer settings.

This directory holds the Gradle Wrapper files, essential for ensuring a consistent build environment for the Android module of the Flutter application. It guarantees that the project is built using a specific Gradle version, simplifying setup and preventing build inconsistencies across different developer machines.

This directory is designated for profile-specific source code or resources for the Android application within the Flutter project. It would contain configurations or assets intended for 'profile' build variants, distinct from debug or release builds, though it is currently empty.

This README details the RustDesk MSI installer project, providing instructions for building, usage, and relevant technical information. It focuses on using Visual Studio and WiX Toolset to create Windows Installer packages for RustDesk.

This Python script preprocesses WiX (Windows Installer XML) source files for the RustDesk application, dynamically generating and modifying installer configurations based on various command-line arguments such as application name, version, and distribution directory.
This is the source file that includes the pre-compiled header (pch.h). It is necessary for compilation to succeed when using pre-compiled headers in the project.
This file is a precompiled header (PCH) for a C++ project. It's used to improve build performance by compiling frequently used headers only once.
This file defines the entry point for a DLL used in MSI custom actions, handling global initialization and finalization when the DLL is attached to or detached from a process.

This file provides functions to read configuration values from a file. It includes utilities to trim whitespace and specifically extracts a value associated with a given key from a configuration file.
This header file provides common declarations and includes necessary Windows and WiX utility headers for developing custom actions within a Microsoft Installer (MSI) package.

This file contains C++ custom actions for a Windows Installer (MSI) package, handling tasks such as process termination, file cleanup during uninstallation, and managing Windows Firewall rules for the application.

This directory is intended to store language-specific resources or localization files for the RustDesk MSI installer package. It likely contains translations or configuration related to different languages supported during the installation process.

This directory is likely intended to contain modular WiX (Windows Installer XML) fragments used in the creation of the RustDesk MSI package. These fragments would define specific components, files, or registry entries for the Windows installer.

This directory likely holds resources or configurations specifically for the User Interface (UI) of the MSI installer package for RustDesk. Its role is to define the visual components and interactive elements presented to the user during the software installation process.

This directory contains the definitions or configurations for individual components within the RustDesk MSI installer package. These components are fundamental units that specify how various files, registry entries, and other resources are installed on a Windows system.
This script pre-processes UI assets (HTML, CSS, and TIS files) by inlining their content and then embeds them as Rust byte array constants into a generated Rust source file, `src/ui/inline.rs`.

This directory is intended to hold metadata and control files required for building Debian packages (.deb) for the RustDesk application. It plays a crucial role in defining package information, dependencies, and installation scripts for Debian-based systems, even if currently empty.

This directory contains patches specifically designed for the F-Droid build of RustDesk. These patches likely address F-Droid specific requirements, such as removing proprietary dependencies or adjusting the build process for inclusion in the F-Droid app store.

This directory contains custom patches specifically for the FFmpeg library, which are applied when FFmpeg is integrated or built using vcpkg within the RustDesk project. These patches likely provide project-specific modifications or fixes to the FFmpeg source code.
This build script compiles and links external C/C++ libraries (like libyuv, libvpx, aom) for a Rust project, handling platform-specific linking methods and generating FFI bindings using bindgen.

This build script (`build.rs`) compiles a C source file (`IddController.c`) into a static library named `win_virtual_display` specifically for Windows targets. It configures the C compiler with platform-specific flags to integrate a virtual display implementation.

This Rust build script conditionally generates configuration for library paths based on the operating system, primarily for X11 libraries on Linux, and links necessary system libraries like `dl` or `c`.
This build script (`build.rs`) is used on Windows to embed resources like an icon and manifest file into the compiled executable using the `winres` crate.

This document outlines a structured, multi-phase process for an AI (Claude) to analyze and improve its own instructions, commands, and configuration for optimizing its performance as a code assistant. It details steps for identifying issues, proposing changes, interacting with a human for feedback, and implementing approved modifications.

This directory contains Fastlane metadata specific to the Android platform for the RustDesk application. It holds localized assets and information for the French (France) region, used during the app store deployment process.

This directory stores Fastlane metadata for the Android version of the RustDesk application. Specifically, it contains localization assets and information tailored for the Dutch (nl-NL) language and region, used for app store listings and other release processes.

This directory stores Fastlane metadata for the Android version of the RustDesk application, specifically containing localized information for Simplified Chinese (zh-CN). It holds content relevant to app store listings or other Fastlane automation tasks for this specific locale.

This directory is designated for storing screenshots of the Android application optimized for 7-inch tablet displays. These images are specifically for the English (en-US) localization of the app's Google Play Store listing, as managed by Fastlane.

Self-Hosted Infrastructure & Administrat.description: Delivers the server-side software and tools necessary to create a private, self-hosted remote access network. It includes capabilities for user management, device grouping, access control, and reviewing audit logs.

files.description: This document outlines the code of conduct for the community, detailing expected behaviors, prohibited actions, and the enforcement process for maintaining a respectful and inclusive environment. It serves as a guide for all contributors and members regarding acceptable conduct and consequences for violations.

This file is the Turkish translation of the Contributor Code of Conduct, outlining expected behaviors, responsibilities, and enforcement guidelines for participants in the RustDesk community. It aims to foster an inclusive and harassment-free environment.
This script provides a command-line interface for managing devices via an API, allowing users to view, enable, disable, delete, and assign properties to devices based on various filters.

This script provides a command-line interface for managing user groups and users within those groups by interacting with an API. It supports operations like viewing, creating, updating, and deleting user groups, as well as viewing and adding users to groups.

This Python script provides a command-line interface for managing users via an API, allowing operations such as viewing, creating, inviting, deleting, enabling/disabling, and managing 2FA/login verification for users.

This Python script provides a command-line interface to manage 'strategies' on a server, including listing, viewing, enabling, disabling, and assigning strategies to devices, users, or device groups via API calls.

This script provides a command-line interface for managing device groups and assigning/unassigning devices to them via an API. It supports operations like viewing, creating, updating, and deleting device groups, as well as listing devices and managing their membership in groups.

This script provides a command-line interface to retrieve and display various types of audit logs (connection, file, alarm, console) from an API. It includes functions for formatting timestamps and converting numerical audit codes into human-readable descriptions.

This file provides a utility for generating a unique, encoded name for a RustDesk custom server executable based on provided server configuration details (key, host, API, relay), and can also parse custom server configuration from a string.

This file manages the periodic collection and synchronization of local system information (sysinfo) with the RustDesk (hbbs) server. It uploads system details, handles configuration updates, and maintains a heartbeat with the server.
Manages OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication for user accounts, including requesting authorization, polling for status, and handling user and device session data.

Client Application Shell.description: Provides the cross-platform graphical user interface for desktop (Windows, macOS, Linux) and mobile (Android, iOS). It manages application settings, an address book, automatic software updates, and platform-specific integrations like the system tray.

files.description: This file is the Japanese-language README for the RustDesk project. It provides an overview of the remote desktop software, instructions for building it from source, details on its file structure, and screenshots.

This Python script serves as a utility for managing internationalization (i18n) files in a Rust project. It provides functionalities to convert translation strings between Rust's string map format and CSV, and to expand/synchronize language files based on a template.
This file contains the Catalan localization strings for the application. It defines a HashMap mapping English phrases to their Catalan translations, used for internationalization.
This README file provides instructions for language translation within the RustDesk project, detailing the template file and the required format for translation entries.
This file contains Arabic localization strings for the application, mapping English phrases to their Arabic translations using a static HashMap.

This file contains French translations for the application's user interface, mapping English strings to their French equivalents. It serves as a localization resource for the RustDesk application.

This file contains Sardinian (sc) translations for the RustDesk application, used for internationalization (i18n). It maps English strings to their corresponding Sardinian phrases.
